page.title: 04Ecology
page.content: Average annual rainfall:- 26.41 inches. Aerage maximum daytime temperature: January 44 F, July 74 F. Winters cold but less snow than in other parts of England. The enlargement of fields by removing hedges has diverted footpaths round edges of fields but many paths remain unaltered. Most common pollution comes now from staw-burning, since the National Farmer's Union issued its guidelines this problem as decreased but not disappeared. 22/46, 23/46:40 acres of opened quarry filled in with 1 million tonnes household/trade refuse; methane gas caused pollution but now controlled by pipework and a flarestack. Small mammals to fox size, toads, frogs, wading birds in winter, sand martins in summer. Rare birds - Kingfisher, barn owl. A meadow containing marsh orchids.
